task.summary: Default task
Adding test of discrete fourier electrostatic field solve. currently does not return expected fields.
Adding OPAL classes.
Confirmed that the tent_dfes class is computing the right phase and the right charge using the Fourier transform and the dot product with the charge.

Fixed a bug in computing the phase in the inverse Fourier transform in the test.
Removed commented out plots from the interp/dep.
Test produces the correct Fourier components for rho.
Test of computing phi from rho returns correct values. Removing some commented out plot/print diagnostics from the various classes to simplify the test.

The depositer computes the correct values for E -- it turns out that these values are just very close to zero due to the pathological combination of particle positions and the limited Fourier modes being used.
Building up to first actual simulation of plasma. Testing periodic boundary conditions and deposition now.
Periodic boundaries work.
Update sequence updates. Now checking if the computed accelerations match analytical results.
Acceleration does not. Removing unnecessary print statements.
There is a bug in the field solve that computes the same field for every particle, which is, of course, wrong.

OPAL has made its first simulation -- the two body problem in two dimensions on a torus with the electrostatic spectral algorithm. Can simulate for a very, very long time and everything works out just dandy.

Fixed a bug where the species couldn't handle weights with opposite signs (i.e. electron versus positron stored as the same species, but with opposite weights) consistently. It computed the potential correctly, but then the acceleration wasn't satisfying Newton's Second Law because of missed cancellation. Bug is now fixed.
Uncovered a bug where the fields are given a sign-flip across boundaries. Wasn't seeing this until I plunked a charge on the boundary and saw the sign flip. Committing to bookmark until I fix it.
Bug in the constants, electron mass was entered six orders of magnitude too large.
Fixed a bug where the charge being used for the charge deposition was actually the particle weight.
Freezing code for debugging, where there is a problem in computing the force on a test particle 1 cm away from a point charge. Factor of 100 off, roughly.

Fixed bug where there is a -x instead of x in the charge deposition. This explains the error in computing the potential everywhere, and also resolved a bug in Newton's Third Law, which is now satisfied. The issue now is the magnitude of the force, which is off and requires detailed going through the algorithm and accounting for every little numerical factor.

Resolved a sign difference between charge deposition and force interpolation related to complex conjugate pairs appearing in the Lagrangian. Still computing accelerations that are too large, and not sure why.

Tracked down presence of Fourier terms. Large number of modes now predicts the correct relative acceleration to within 1%, which particle shapes which are ~10% of the particle separation, so errors are as one would expect from shapes with quadrupole moments in their fields, as we have for our tent functions.

MESSAGE.value: Adding test of discrete fourier electrostatic field solve. currently does not return expected fields.
Adding OPAL classes.
Confirmed that the tent_dfes class is computing the right phase and the right charge using the Fourier transform and the dot product with the charge.

Fixed a bug in computing the phase in the inverse Fourier transform in the test.
Removed commented out plots from the interp/dep.
Test produces the correct Fourier components for rho.

The depositer computes the correct values for E -- it turns out that these values are just very close to zero due to the pathological combination of particle positions and the limited Fourier modes being used.
Building up to first actual simulation of plasma. Testing periodic boundary conditions and deposition now.

Update sequence updates. Now checking if the computed accelerations match analytical results.

There is a bug in the field solve that computes the same field for every particle, which is, of course, wrong.

This explains the error in computing the potential everywhere, and also resolved a bug in Newton's Third Law, which is now satisfied. The issue now is the magnitude of the force, which is off and requires detailed going through the algorithm and accounting for every little numerical factor.

Resolved a sign difference between charge deposition and force interpolation related to complex conjugate pairs appearing in the Lagrangian. Still computing accelerations that are too large, and not sure why.

Tracked down presence of Fourier terms. Large number of modes now predicts the correct relative acceleration to within 1%, which particle shapes which are ~10% of the particle separation, so errors are as one would expect from shapes with quadrupole moments in their fields, as we have for our tent functions.
